page.title: 08Education
page.content: In Chesham in 1985 there is a three tier system of education.The first is for children aged between 5-8 years.The next is for children aged between 8-12 years.When you are 12,you take an exam, the 12+,to decide which school you will next attend.If you pass you attend a grammar school and if not,you go to a secondary modern.When you start a secondary school you attend from ages 12-18,although you can leave at 16. In our block there are 3 primary schools,1 secondary modern for girls, 1 middle school and 1 combined school. The subjects which we study in form 8 are mathematics,English,history, geography,science,art,needlework for girls,craft for boys,projects,games, French and P.E.. 19 of our class are going to grammar schools,13 are going to secondary modern and 2 are undecided.
